meanings.definition: temporarily prevent from continuing or being in force
meanings.sent1: The teacher suspended the game due to the storm.
meanings.sent2: The principal suspended the student for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent3: The rain suspended our plans for a picnic, but we had a fun indoor party instead.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected power outage suspended our online meeting abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The bridge construction was suspended until the weather improved.

meanings.sent1: The chandelier was suspended from the ceiling in the grand hall.
meanings.sent2: The spider suspended itself from a thin thread of silk.
meanings.sent3: The colorful pinata was suspended high above the children's heads.
meanings.sent4: The hammock was suspended between two sturdy trees in the backyard.
meanings.sent5: The artwork was suspended on the gallery wall for everyone to admire.

meanings.sent1: The bad weather suspended the outdoor event until the next day.
meanings.sent2: The airline suspended all flights due to the volcanic ash cloud.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to suspend baking the cake until more ingredients arrived.
meanings.sent4: The decision to suspend the project was made to gather more information.
meanings.sent5: The repair work was suspended temporarily to address safety concerns.

meanings.definition: keep in a state of indecision or inactivity
meanings.sent1: The unresolved issue suspended the team's progress on the project.
meanings.sent2: The mystery novel suspended the reader in anticipation of the next chapter.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick suspended disbelief in the audience's minds.
meanings.sent4: The unresolved conflict suspended peace in the community.
meanings.sent5: The unanswered question suspended curiosity in the classroom.
